types.name: AbstractOrder
types.description:
Mixin for the Order and Checkout models.

It provides common fields and methods.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: List of actions that can be performed in the current state of an order.

fields.name: authorizeStatus
fields.description: The authorize status of the order.

fields.name: availableCollectionPoints
fields.description: Collection points that can be used for this order.

fields.name: availableShippingMethods
fields.description: Shipping methods that can be used with this order.
fields.deprecationReason: Use `shippingMethods`, this field will be removed in 4.0

fields.name: canFinalize
fields.description: Informs whether a draft order can be finalized (turned into a regular order).

fields.name: chargeStatus
fields.description: The charge status of the order.

fields.name: customerEmail
fields.description: Email of a customer.

fields.name: customerPhone
fields.description: Phone number of a customer.

fields.name: discounts
fields.description: List of all discounts assigned to the order.

fields.name: displayGrossPrices
fields.description: Determines whether checkout prices should include taxes when displayed in a storefront.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred during order validation.

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of events associated with the order.

fields.name: fulfillmentDeadline
fields.description: The date and time when fulfillment of the order must be completed.

fields.name: fulfillmentMethod
fields.description: The delivery method selected for this checkout.

fields.name: fulfillments
fields.description: List of shipments for the order.

fields.name: invoices
fields.description: List of order invoices. Can be fetched for orders created in Tempo 3.2 and later, for other orders requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_ORDERS, OWNER.

fields.name: isPaid
fields.description: Informs if an order is fully paid.

fields.name: languageCode
fields.description: Order language code.

fields.name: metafield
fields.description: A single key from public metadata. Tip: Use GraphQL aliases to fetch multiple keys.

fields.name: metafields
fields.description: Public metadata. Use `keys` to control which fields you want to include. The default is to include everything.

fields.name: origin
fields.description: The order origin.

fields.name: original
fields.description: The ID of the order that was the base for this order.

fields.name: pointsOfContact
fields.description: List of points of contact for order fulfillment.

fields.name: privateMetadata
fields.description: List of private metadata items. Requires staff permissions to access.

fields.name: privateMetafields
fields.description: Private metadata. Requires staff permissions to access. Use `keys` to control which fields you want to include. The default is to include everything.

fields.name: shippingMethods
fields.description: Shipping methods related to this order.

fields.name: shippingPrice
fields.description: Total price of shipping.

fields.name: shippingTaxClass
fields.description: Denormalized tax class assigned to the shipping method.

fields.name: shippingTaxClassMetadata
fields.description: Denormalized public metadata of the shipping method's tax class.

fields.name: shippingTaxClassName
fields.description: Denormalized name of the tax class assigned to the shipping method.

fields.name: shippingTaxClassPrivateMetadata
fields.description: Denormalized private metadata of the shipping method's tax class. Requires staff permissions to access.

fields.name: shippingTaxRate
fields.description: The shipping tax rate value.

fields.name: subtotal
fields.description: The sum of line prices not including shipping.

fields.name: taxExemption
fields.description: Returns True if order has to be exempt from taxes.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total amount of the order.

fields.name: totalAuthorized
fields.description: Amount authorized for the order.

fields.name: totalBalance
fields.description: The difference between the paid and the order total amount.

fields.name: totalCaptured
fields.description: Amount captured by payment.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: List of transactions for the order.

fields.name: undiscountedTotal
fields.description: Undiscounted total amount of the order.

fields.name: quantityAvailable
fields.description: Quantity of a product available for sale in one checkout. Field value will be `null` when no `maxItemCountPerCheckout` in global settings has been set, and `productVariant` stocks are not tracked.

fields.name: quantityOrdered
fields.description: Total quantity ordered.

fields.name: revenue
fields.description: Total revenue generated by a variant in given period of time. Note: this field should be queried using `reportProductSales` query as it uses optimizations suitable for such calculations.

fields.name: stocks
fields.description: Stocks for the product variant.

fields.name: taxClass
fields.description: Tax class assigned to this product type. All products of this product type use this tax class, unless it's overridden in the `Product` type.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: Get a single variant by SKU or ID.

fields.name: variants
fields.description: List of variants for the product. Requires the following permissions to include the unpublished items: MANAGE_ORDERS, MANAGE_DISCOUNTS, MANAGE_PRODUCTS.

types.name: Group
types.description:
A permission group.

Groups are a generic way of categorizing users to apply permissions, or
some other label, to those users. A user can belong to any number of
groups.

A user in a group automatically has all the permissions granted to that
group. For example, if the group 'Site editors' has the permission
can_edit_home_page, any user in that group will have that permission.

Beyond permissions, groups are a convenient way to categorize users to
apply some label, or extended functionality, to them. For example, you
could create a group 'Special users', and you could write code that would
do special things to those users -- such as giving them access to a
members-only portion of your site, or sending them members-only email
messages.

types.name: PaymentFilter
types.description:
A model that represents a single payment.

This might be a transactable payment information such as credit card
details, gift card information or a customer's authorization to charge
their PayPal account.

All payment process related pieces of information are stored
at the gateway level, we are operating on the reusable token
which is a unique identifier of the customer for given gateway.

Several payment methods can be used within a single order. Each payment
method may consist of multiple transactions.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: hasPerm
directives.description:
Will check if the user has any/all permissions to resolve this.

When the condition fails, the following can be returned (following this priority):
1) `OperationInfo`/`OperationMessage` if those types are allowed at the return type
2) `null` in case the field is not mandatory (e.g. `String` or `[String]`)
3) An empty list in case the field is a list (e.g. `[String]!`)
4) An empty `Connection` in case the return type is a relay connection
2) Otherwise, an error will be raised

directives.name: hasPermission
directives.description:
Will check if the user has any/all permissions to resolve this.

When the condition fails, the following can be returned (following this priority):
1) `OperationInfo`/`OperationMessage` if those types are allowed at the return type
2) `null` in case the field is not mandatory (e.g. `String` or `[String]`)
3) An empty list in case the field is a list (e.g. `[String]!`)
4) An empty `Connection` in case the return type is a relay connection
2) Otherwise, an error will be raised

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
